website_summaries.verdict: One of the nicer-looking and better-performing Chrome OS systems, the 13-inch Acer Chromebook adds some zip by ditching Intel for an Nvidia processor, but also hits a few issues with popular Chrome apps.
pros: The Acer Chromebook has a slim design, a high-res 13-inch screen, and a fast Nvidia K1 processor for a graphics and battery boost over other Chromebooks
cons: Like other Chromebooks, offline functionality is extremely limited
The large screen lacks touch input, and the ARM processor presents some compatibility issues, even with online Chrome apps

customer_reviews.title: My first Chromebook!
customer_reviews.text: I was ready for an upgrade from my HP laptop and decided on a Chromebook since I use Google Docs for work. Love the 4G of memory as that helps me keep 12 tabs open at once while still surfing the net! Coming from Windows 8 and using Chrome OS has been a pleasure! Also a long battery life and low res screen has been a plus!
customer_reviews.author: JCo

customer_reviews.title: Not a Windows replacement but good supplement.
customer_reviews.text: I use it as a supplement to my Windows laptop. I keep in my bedroom to read emails, browse the web, etc. Some annoyances are the lack of Skype and other Windows software, although there is a Skype web beta now. I agree with others that you could use your Office 365 account to use the web-based MS products, but they lack all features. I am also an avid PC gamer so will always need a Windows machine. I would not use it as my primary. That being said, this is a great product, lots of power and features for what it was designed to do.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Smurthwaite

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended Chromebook
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Chromebook. My second one and this is far superior to the HP I also own. Very attractive, light weight and works like a dream. I use it in conjunction with my desktop and regular laptop as there are some times when I need a harddrive capability that is not available with the Chromebooks.
customer_reviews.author: CommanderRB

customer_reviews.title: A decent media and light utility device
customer_reviews.text: This Chromebook is great. It's nothing fancy, no bells and whistles really. My wife uses it for basic web browsing, video streaming and light online work. It does what we need it to with decent battery life. That's about all you can expect from this, but if you're looking for a bigger screen than an iPad and a little more ability to word process and other light duties than an iPad can excel at, this is the thing to get.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Chromebook gets it done!
customer_reviews.text: Love my Chromebook. Boots up fast and lightning quick! Love the Google apps too. A no brainer. So much better than a notebook and I love the cloud technology too. Be sure to check the compatibility of your printer before you purchase. No complaints and I would recommend to anyone looking to dump their notebook and something different.
customer_reviews.author: OL'DC

customer_reviews.title: Mine literally fell apart and no one cared.
customer_reviews.text: The chrome book was great but in just a few weeks the screen started separating from the lid and no one wanted to help me. If I would have got help it would be five stars but since I'm stuck with a broken computer not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Jerrell

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with it
customer_reviews.text: this Chromebook is the fastest l'v ever used. Very happy with it. from but up to reading email in less thin 30 seconds.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Laptop great. Chrome is ok.
customer_reviews.text: Great if you are always online. The offline version does not synch with the online. This is more of a Chrome complaint. The laptop itself is great!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our kids last Christmas, but I like it so much that it has become my my laptop replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Great gift. Husband and daughter loved it and use ...
customer_reviews.text: Great gift. Husband and daughter loved it and use in preference to their desk top computers.
customer_reviews.author: Movie Watcher

customer_reviews.title: First time purchasing and using a Chromebook OS system. ...
customer_reviews.text: First time purchasing and using a Chromebook OS system. At first I planned to use this laptop for travel due to long battery life and weight. However, there are many functions that are kind of inferior to regular Windows 7/8 laptops. I find it inconvenient sometimes and just a hassle to use. In the end, I'm not too much of a fan for the Chromebook and it's been catching dust in the room.
customer_reviews.author: NT

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: I doesnt have a cd or dvd drive wish it did
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My fault for not doing enough research. I thought ...
customer_reviews.text: My fault for not doing enough research. I thought I would be able to replace my WIN7 laptop, but, no such luck. Chromebooks are just a big android device with many limitations.
customer_reviews.author: A.S.Goldman

customer_reviews.title: It worked great..
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this zero stars. It worked great ... for a month. The Chromebook stopped being able to charge. To Acer's credit, they did fix the Chromebook. However, it's taken two weeks, and dealing with Fedex has been a hassle. Next time I'll go Best Buy, not Amazon for electronics with a protection plan, and not Acer.
customer_reviews.author: Stahzzman

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: The screen is to only 13" make difficult to watch movie
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: Use of the NVIIA Tegra K1 makes this perfect for low power consumption and reasonable speed
customer_reviews.text: The device functions exactly as advertised. Use of the NVIIA Tegra K1 makes this perfect for low power consumption and reasonable speed. If you have several (more than 3 or 4) windows open at once, you might experience a sluggish performance. The device architecture limits its ability to load alternate operating systems - read up before you purchase.
customer_reviews.author: David Bisciotti

customer_reviews.title: Great build and performance
customer_reviews.text: My first Chromebook and only in my first week into usage, but I have been very impressed with the build and speed of the machine. It definitely outperform my old 5 year old Win7 laptop (when using Chrome browser) Those web reviews about the display doesn't really matter to me. I felt the display was good enough for me. This Chromebook will be ideal for everyone, as long as they understand and accept the limitation of what Chrome OS cannot do.
customer_reviews.author: Desean
